title: How to Fold a Targaryen Dragon Out of Paper

steps.headline: Inside reverse fold the points down.
steps.description: These will act as the wings.

steps.headline: Valley fold the sides inwards.
steps.description: Squash fold the top of the wings.

steps.headline: Fold the sides of the middle section towards the centre.
Fold the sides of the bottom towards the centre.
steps.description: They probably won't meet exactly in the middle.

steps.headline: Fold the sides of the middle section in towards the centre.
steps.description: These will later act as the dragon's arms.

steps.headline: Fold the top back up, creating a zig-zag fold.
Pull the top over to the side.
steps.description: The zig-zag fold should act as the pivot.

steps.headline: Tear along the indicated line.
steps.description: Tear the top AND bottom layers, but do NOT tear the middle layers.

steps.headline: Outside reverse fold the top forwards.
steps.description: This is the head of the dragon.

steps.headline: Fold up the edges of the head to make the dragon's ears.
Inside reverse fold the bottom to make the tail.
Tear along the indicated line.
steps.description: Tear the top AND bottom layers, but do NOT tear the middle layers.

steps.headline: Fold down the torn sections to make an arrowhead.
Take the two sections in the middle (from the tears in step 8 and folds in step 14) and fold them so that they are at right angles to the body of the dragon.
Fold down the tips of the arms to make the dragon's claws.
steps.description: If you do this correctly, your completed dragon should be able to balance on your finger.

steps.headline: Fold the wings forward, at the point where they meet the dragon's body.
Fold the dragon's wings about halfway along, then unfold.
Position the wing folds so that they look good.
Colour in the dragon (optional).
steps.description: Use pencils, not felt tips. Some possible colour schemes are: black (Balerion the black dread), black with red wing and spine accents, and red eyes (Drogon), silver with gold eyes (Meraxes), white with gold wing and spine accents, and gold eyes (Viserion), and green with bronze wing and spine accents, and bronze eyes (Rhaegal). Further (but not as well-known) colour schemes from Game of Thrones include gold with pink wings (Sunfyre), bronze with tan accents (Vermithor), pale green with pearl accents (Moondancer), red (Caraxes), grey (Grey Ghost) or brown (Sheepstealer).

text: Start with a bird base.  Inside reverse fold the points down. These will act as the wings. Fold the front up.  Valley fold the sides inwards. Squash fold the top of the wings. Turn over.  Fold the bottom upwards.  Turn over.  Tear along the indicated lines.  Turn over.  Fold the sides of the middle section towards the centre.  Fold the top down.  Fold the sides of the bottom towards the centre. They probably won't meet exactly in the middle. Turn over.  Fold the sides of the middle section in towards the centre. These will later act as the dragon's arms. Turn over.  Fold the top down.  Fold the top back up, creating a zig-zag fold.  Fold in half.  Pull the top over to the side. The zig-zag fold should act as the pivot. Tear along the indicated line. Tear the top AND bottom layers, but do NOT tear the middle layers. Fold the torn sections upwards.  Outside reverse fold the top forwards. This is the head of the dragon. Fold up the edges of the head to make the dragon's ears.  Inside reverse fold the bottom to make the tail.  Tear along the indicated line. Tear the top AND bottom layers, but do NOT tear the middle layers. Fold down the torn sections to make an arrowhead.  Take the two sections in the middle (from the tears in step 8 and folds in step 14) and fold them so that they are at right angles to the body of the dragon. These are the dragon's arms. Fold down the tips of the arms to make the dragon's claws. If you do this correctly, your completed dragon should be able to balance on your finger. Fold the wings forward, at the point where they meet the dragon's body.  Unfold.  Fold the dragon's wings about halfway along, then unfold.  Position the wing folds so that they look good.  Colour in the dragon (optional). Use pencils, not felt tips. Some possible colour schemes are: black (Balerion the black dread), black with red wing and spine accents, and red eyes (Drogon), silver with gold eyes (Meraxes), white with gold wing and spine accents, and gold eyes (Viserion), and green with bronze wing and spine accents, and bronze eyes (Rhaegal). Further (but not as well-known) colour schemes from Game of Thrones include gold with pink wings (Sunfyre), bronze with tan accents (Vermithor), pale green with pearl accents (Moondancer), red (Caraxes), grey (Grey Ghost) or brown (Sheepstealer).
